statement.tex: \\ \text{If we said that }\\ \quad I_1 = \int\dfrac{(1-\cos^2 x)^2}{\cos^2 x}dx \\ \text{will evaluate to the following, then would}\\ \text{we be right?}

reason.tex: \begin{align} I_1 &= \int\dfrac{(1-\cos^2 x)^2}{\cos^2 x}dx \\ &= \int\dfrac{1+\cos^4 x - 2\cos^2 x}{\cos^2 x}dx \\ &= \int\sec^2 xdx + \int\cos^2 xdx - 2\int dx \\ &= \tan x + \underbrace{\int\dfrac{1+\cos 2x}{2}dx}_{\cos^2\theta = \frac{1+\cos 2\theta}{2}}-2x\\ &= \tan x + \int\dfrac{dx}{2} + \int\dfrac{\cos 2x}{2}dx - 2x \\ &= \tan x + \underbrace{\dfrac{\sin 2x}{4}}_{\int\cos N\theta d\theta = \frac{\sin N\theta}{N}} -\dfrac{3}{2}x + C_1 \end{align}

\text{Find }I_2\text{ like we found }I_1 \\ \begin{align} I_2 &= \int\dfrac{(1-\sin^2 x)^2}{\sin^2 x}dx \\ &= \int\csc^2 x + \int\dfrac{1-\cos 2x}{2} dx - 2\int dx \\ &= \cot x + \dfrac{x}{2}-\dfrac{\sin 2x}{4} -2x + C_2 \\ &= \cot x -\dfrac{\sin 2x}{4} - \dfrac{3}{2}x + C_2 \end{align} \\ \text{And hence, }\\ \begin{align} I &= I_1 + I_2 \\ &= \left[\tan x + \dfrac{\sin 2x}{4} - \dfrac{3}{2}x \right]\\ &+ \left[\cot x - \dfrac{\sin 2x}{4} - \dfrac{3}{2}x\right] + C \\ &= \tan x + \cot x - 3x + C \end{align}
